intro: Xysmalobium dissolutum, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It has a short, erect stem with few leaves, and its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Xysmalobium dissolutum is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in harsh desert climates.
